div.p: Available throughout the textbase, this element is not to be confused with scholarNotes that will be readable by end users. ResearchNote contents will be seen only by the eyes of Orlandians. Contains comments from one team member to another; which should be prefaced by initials of the writer, and which are not visible in delivery. An Orlandian writing a new entry will may leave Researchnotes for or receive them from another who is checking or revising; these can be deleted once implemented or decided against. Retain only notes that may be useful downstream, like “exhaustive search for firm date reveals nothing” or “recommended visual for this writer”. (Researchnotes containing the word “visual” are clues to project of illustrating Orlando.)

If you encounter ResearchNotes that refer to completed actions of negligible importance, feel free to delete them. However, you will want to retain researchNotes that say things like "this is a typo/no it's not" because they may save us a step later on. Retain researchNotes that have substantive information or queries about sources or research processes. If in doubt, leave it in.
